flow.descriptionCdata:
d4f702e1-4894-4dd6-bacf-e35f61675270.0b2b768e-d612-4955-87ac-fbd8c003cc4e.prompt=Enter a value for xenUsername d4f702e1-4894-4dd6-bacf-e35f61675270.11890ac0-dff6-462f-932e-f5b3851ca033.prompt=Enter a value for xenHostname d4f702e1-4894-4dd6-bacf-e35f61675270.1ce060f7-d94c-4ec7-9a8f-ee08ff14aa66.prompt=Enter a value for xenUsername d4f702e1-4894-4dd6-bacf-e35f61675270.20622d50-ffb5-4a30-bebe-9cfb507b31c3.description=
Checks to see if a string matches a specific rule.

Inputs\:
matchType - The type of match to perform.
toMatch - The string to check if matches another string.
matchTo - The string to match against.
ignoreCase - Boolean value for whether or not to ignore case during match.

Responses\:
success - The String matched.
failure - The string did not match, or something went wrong.
d4f702e1-4894-4dd6-bacf-e35f61675270.2901f148-14f1-4893-b34a-dcf93a773525.prompt=Enter a value for uuid d4f702e1-4894-4dd6-bacf-e35f61675270.3630c092-0c91-468c-8c42-0eb17cf0c8f6.prompt=Enter a value for xenPassword d4f702e1-4894-4dd6-bacf-e35f61675270.51123f50-0ded-43c0-a275-cc1ea8588012.prompt=Enter a value for xenPassword d4f702e1-4894-4dd6-bacf-e35f61675270.63fa575e-45a1-4f8d-b365-b7d45d9f9c17.prompt=Enter a value for xenPassword d4f702e1-4894-4dd6-bacf-e35f61675270.68c3ec8d-139d-4cc1-8fa6-213b6c6284bc.prompt=Enter a value for uuid d4f702e1-4894-4dd6-bacf-e35f61675270.71a6d583-5d30-4d11-b359-62d6ca764c3c.prompt=Enter a value for xenHostname d4f702e1-4894-4dd6-bacf-e35f61675270.7f3c595c-ccfc-45cb-bb11-c858249135fa.prompt=Enter a value for xenHostname d4f702e1-4894-4dd6-bacf-e35f61675270.8ef1ca93-29cd-4ecf-a3da-f8ec22eaa584.prompt=Enter a value for uuid d4f702e1-4894-4dd6-bacf-e35f61675270.a174bb7d-cb05-4f20-b618-76cefe1d3a5c.description=
Unpauses the given VM. The VM needs to be in 'paused' state. If async is set to false, then tries to execute the operation synchronously. Else returns information about the task that represents the asynchronous operation.

Inputs\:
xenHostname - The host that XenServer is running on
xenUsername - The user to connect to XenServer as
xenPassword - The password for the XenServer user
xenProtocol - The protocol for connecting to XenServer (http/https). Defaults to http.
xenPort - The port number at which to connect to XenServer (defaults to port 80)
uuid - The unique identifier for the XenServer object
async - Asynchronously perform the task. Values\: true/false (defaults to true)

Responses\:
success - The operation completed successfully.
failure - Something went wrong.

Returns\:
uuid - The unique identifier for the XenServer Object
name - The name of the XenServer Object
description - The description of the XenServer Object
allowedOperations - The list of operations that are allowed to execute on the object
currentOperations - The list of operations currently running on the object
VMParent - The host on which the object/task is running on
createDate - The time the task was created
finishedDate - The time the task finished
status - The status of the task
progress - The progress level of the task
result - The result returned by the task
type - The type of result returned by the task
errorInfo - If an error occurred, contains some information about the errors
returnResult - String containing all the key/value pairs describing the Unpause VM task (if running asynchronously)
d4f702e1-4894-4dd6-bacf-e35f61675270.a18e8729-9966-4449-8f26-9abdfe888337.prompt=Enter a value for xenHostname d4f702e1-4894-4dd6-bacf-e35f61675270.cd7cbf19-42f0-4891-ad57-f42b7d4c0e71.description=
Resumes the given VM. The VM needs to be in 'suspended' state. If async is set to false, then tries to execute the operation synchronously. Else returns information about the task that represents the asynchronous operation.

Inputs\:
xenHostname - The host that XenServer is running on
xenUsername - The user to connect to XenServer as
xenPassword - The password for the XenServer user
xenProtocol - The protocol for connecting to XenServer (http/https). Defaults to http.
xenPort - The port number at which to connect to XenServer (defaults to port 80)
uuid - The unique identifier for the XenServer object
async - Asynchronously perform the task. Values\: true/false (defaults to true)
runOnHost - The XenServer host to run the operation on. If not specified XenServer will determine an appropriate host from the pool
force - Attempt to force the VM to start. If this flag is false then the VM may fail pre-boot safety checks. Values\: true/false (defaults to false)
startPaused - Start VM in paused state if set to true. Values\: true/false (defaults to false)

Responses\:
success - The operation completed successfully.
failure - Something went wrong.

Returns\:
uuid - The unique identifier for the XenServer Object
name - The name of the XenServer Object
description - The description of the XenServer Object
allowedOperations - The list of operations that are allowed to execute on the object
currentOperations - The list of operations currently running on the object
VMParent - The host on which the object/task is running on
createDate - The time the task was created
finishedDate - The time the task finished
status - The status of the task
progress - The progress level of the task
result - The result returned by the task
type - The type of result returned by the task
errorInfo - If an error occurred, contains some information about the errors
returnResult - String containing all the key/value pairs describing the Resume VM task (if running asynchronously)
d4f702e1-4894-4dd6-bacf-e35f61675270.ce3cf84a-4d5e-4e5b-a719-af4ea708c643.description=
Finds VMs on XenServer. Searches based on UUID if provided. Else searches based on the name field. If isSearchExpression is set to true, searches name labels that contain the given name. If neither UUID or name are provided, all records are returned.

Inputs\:
xenHostname - The host that XenServer is running on
xenUsername - The user to connect to XenServer as
xenPassword - The password for the XenServer user
xenProtocol - The protocol for connecting to XenServer (http/https). Defaults to http.
xenPort - The port number at which to connect to XenServer (defaults to port 80)
uuid - The unique identifier for the XenServer object
name - The name or label of the XenServer object
isSearchExpression - Is the provided name/label a search string (If true searches names 'containing' the provided name, else searches for the 'exact' name). Values\: true/false (defaults to false)

Responses\:
success - The operation completed successfully.
failure - Something went wrong.

Returns\:
uuid - The unique identifier for the XenServer Object
name - The name of the XenServer Object
description - The description of the XenServer Object
allowedOperations - The list of operations that are allowed to execute on the object
currentOperations - The list of operations currently running on the object
powerState - The power state of the object
VMParent - The host on which the object/task is running on
VMAffinity - The XenServer Host which the VM has preference for running on
VMIsTemplate - Is the Virtual Machine a template?
returnResult - String containing all the key/value pairs describing each VM
d4f702e1-4894-4dd6-bacf-e35f61675270.d2a0221c-816e-4ae9-93d0-85ea57d7e9c0.description=
Checks to see if a string matches a specific rule.

Inputs\:
matchType - The type of match to perform.
toMatch - The string to check if matches another string.
matchTo - The string to match against.
ignoreCase - Boolean value for whether or not to ignore case during match.

Responses\:
success - The String matched.
failure - The string did not match, or something went wrong.
d4f702e1-4894-4dd6-bacf-e35f61675270.d7894d6e-6ad0-4be2-a2b2-b85c9079e65d.description=
Powers on a VM. The VM needs to be in 'halted' state. If async is set to false, then tries to execute the operation synchronously. Else returns information about the task that represents the asynchronous operation.

Inputs\:
xenHostname - The host that XenServer is running on
xenUsername - The user to connect to XenServer as
xenPassword - The password for the XenServer user
xenProtocol - The protocol for connecting to XenServer (http/https). Defaults to http.
xenPort - The port number at which to connect to XenServer (defaults to port 80)
uuid - The unique identifier for the XenServer object
async - Asynchronously perform the task. Values\: true/false (defaults to true)
runOnHost - The XenServer host to run the operation on. If not specified XenServer will determine an appropriate host from the pool
force - Attempt to force the VM to start. If this flag is false then the VM may fail pre-boot safety checks. Values\: true/false (defaults to false)
startPaused - Start VM in paused state if set to true. Values\: true/false (defaults to false)

Responses\:
success - The operation completed successfully.
failure - Something went wrong.

Returns\:
uuid - The unique identifier for the XenServer Object
name - The name of the XenServer Object
description - The description of the XenServer Object
allowedOperations - The list of operations that are allowed to execute on the object
currentOperations - The list of operations currently running on the object
VMParent - The host on which the object/task is running on
createDate - The time the task was created
finishedDate - The time the task finished
status - The status of the task
progress - The progress level of the task
result - The result returned by the task
type - The type of result returned by the task
errorInfo - If an error occurred, contains some information about the errors
returnResult - String containing all the key/value pairs describing the Start VM task (if running asynchronously)
d4f702e1-4894-4dd6-bacf-e35f61675270.d9a881e8-0e5b-4212-a2fb-619d88497281.prompt=Enter a value for xenUsername d4f702e1-4894-4dd6-bacf-e35f61675270.ddb23b91-8b63-47c7-986a-29c2d6eadbba.prompt=Enter a value for xenUsername d4f702e1-4894-4dd6-bacf-e35f61675270.description=
This flow changes the state of a given virtual machine from VMWare Virtual Infrastructure Server to running. It starts the VM when it is stopped or resumes it when it is paused.

Inputs\:
vmHost - The hostname of the Virtualization product to connect to.
vmUsername - The username for vmHost
vmPassword - The password for vmUsername
vmPort - The port that the virtualization product is listening on (Applicable only to VMWare Virtual Infrastructure)
vmProtocol - The protocol the virtualization product expects (Applicable only to VMWare Virtual Infrastructure).
uuid - The uuid of the vm to start.

Responses\:
success - The flow completed successfully.
failure - something went wrong.

Returns\:
vms - A comma delimited list of hosted vms.
d4f702e1-4894-4dd6-bacf-e35f61675270.ef2d6881-c58f-4f60-9cee-e987cc156a66.prompt=Enter a value for xenPassword
flow.name: Change XenServer VM to Running
